intro: Lisianthius exaltatus var. albiflorus, commonly known as the white-flowered lisianthius, is a striking member of the Asteraceae family. It is native to the Caribbean and is characterized by its tall, branched stems and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. The plant produces showy, daisy-like blooms that are typically 1–3 inches in diameter, with yellow centers and white petals. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it a popular choice for gardeners in tropical and subtropical regions. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its long flowering period, which can extend from summer through fall.
